Subject: Evolving Neural Turing Machines
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=m_2lvr1wpxPnh0wbbA22hu63tMfvTi5IGC6wUkcYARLhXc9PJBk82IM
X-Yahoo-Profile: sebastian.risi
From: Sebastian Risi <sebastian.risi@...>

Hi all,

Rasmus Boll Greve, Emil Juul Jacobsen, and myself are happy to
announce a new paper about evolving Neural Turing Machines. Graves et
al. recently introduced the concept of a Neural Turing Machines by
extending the capabilities of a neural network with an external memory
bank. This architecture was able to learn simple algorithms through
gradient descent such as copying, sorting and recall from example
data.

In our work we show that a similar ANN can be evolved with NEAT, which
greatly simplifies the neural model, generalizes better, and does not
require accessing the entire memory content at each time-step. We show
preliminary results on a simple copy and T-Maze learning task. In the
T-Maze learning task the agent uses the memory bank to display
adaptive behavior that normally requires plastic (or recurrent)
networks, thereby suggesting a complementary mechanism for adaptive
behavior in NE.

This paper will be published as part of the upcoming 2015 NIPS
Workshop on Reasoning, Attention, Memory (RAM). We hope you find it
interesting and are looking forward to your comments!

http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/greve_ram15.pdf

Best,
Sebastian

-- 
Dr. Sebastian Risi
